page.title: United Church, The Chapel on the Hill

revision.text:
{{Infobox NRHP | name = United Church, The Chapel on the Hill | partof = Oak Ridge Historic District | nrhp_type = cp | nocat = yes | image = Oak-ridge-united-church-tn1.jpg | caption = The Chapel on the Hill | location= [[Oak Ridge, Tennessee]] | coordinates = {{coord|36.03046|-84.24226|display=inline,title}} | locmapin = Tennessee#USA | built = 1943 | architect = [[U.S. Army Corps of Engineers]] | architecture = | added = September 05, 1991 | area = 700-series [[U.S. Army]] chapel | mpsub = {{NRHP url|id=64500613|title=Oak Ridge MPS}} | refnum = 91001109<ref name="nris">{{NRISref|2010a}}</ref> }} The '''United Church, Chapel on the Hill''' in [[Oak Ridge, Tennessee]] was the city's main church during [[World War II]]. Dedicated on September 30, 1943 and completed late in October 1943, it was originally a multi-denominational [[chapel]] shared by [[Catholic Church|Catholic]], [[Protestantism|Protestant]] and [[Judaism|Jewish]] congregations.<ref name=NationalRegister/><ref name=churchhistory>[http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=category&sectionid=4&id=39&Itemid=55 Church History] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110728092956/http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=category&sectionid=4&id=39&Itemid=55 |date=July 28, 2011 }}, United Church, Chapel on the Hill website, accessed March 5, 2010</ref>
== Architectural design == The building design is a [[U.S. Army Corps of Engineers]] 700-series [[U.S. Army]] chapel.<ref name=Townsite>[http://oakridgevisitor.com/history/pdf/OriginalTownSites.pdf Chapel on the Hill] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080517124718/http://oakridgevisitor.com/history/pdf/OriginalTownSites.pdf |date=May 17, 2008 }} in ''Jackson Square – the original Townsite'', Oak Ridge Convention and Visitors' Bureau</ref> It is a frame building built on a three-bay rectangular plan with a [[Steeple (architecture)|steeple]]d [[bell tower]] and a [[gable]] entry [[porch]]. It was one of three Army chapels built using the same design in Oak Ridge during World War II. One of the other two chapels, the West Chapel in the city's West Village area, was later torn down, but the East Chapel in the East Village is still in use.<ref name=NationalRegister>{{cite web|url=http://www.cfo.doe.gov/me70/history/NPSweb/Oak_Ridge_Historic_District_(Preferred).pdf |title=National Register of Historic Places Registration Form for Oak Ridge Historic District |date=July 18, 1991 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100829041710/http://www.cfo.doe.gov/me70/history/NPSweb/Oak_Ridge_Historic_District_%28Preferred%29.pdf |archivedate=August 29, 2010}}</ref>
== History == The U.S. Army built the chapel to house religious activities, as one of numerous community facilities in the "townsite" area of Oak Ridge. The building was dedicated on September 30, 1943, in a ceremony that included [[prayer]]s and talks by a Jewish [[rabbi]], a [[priesthood (Catholic Church)|Catholic priest]], an [[Episcopal Church (United States)|Episcopal]] priest, a [[Baptist]] minister, and the [[minister (Christianity)|minister]] who was serving the United Church congregation that eventually came to own the chapel.<ref>Charles W. Johnson and Charles O. Jackson (1981), ''City Behind a Fence: Oak Ridge, Tennessee, 1942-1946''. The University of Tennessee Press. Pages 127-129.</ref> Its name, "The Chapel on the Hill," comes from a reference in a prayer by the Knoxville Baptist minister who participated in the dedication.<ref name=Townsite/>
The United Church congregation that is housed in the Chapel on the Hill traces its history to July 18, 1943, when some 25 to 30 Christians of diverse denominational backgrounds gathered for Sunday worship in Oak Ridge's main [[cafeteria]]. Subsequently, several members of the group made plans to establish an interdenominational Protestant church, led by [[laity|layperson]]s, to include all denominations. A [[Presbyterian]] minister working in [[Knoxville, Tennessee|Knoxville]] was engaged to conduct weekly services, and about 150 people representing 13 Protestant denominations became charter members of "the United Church". Governing boards of laypersons elected to lead the new congregation took up their duties on October 24, 1943.<ref name=pre1980>[http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=51&Itemid=55 Pre-1980 Historical Compilation] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110728093006/http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=51&Itemid=55 |date=July 28, 2011 }}, United Church, Chapel on the Hill website, accessed March 5, 2010</ref>
When the Chapel-on-the-Hill was completed that same month, the United Church and the local Roman Catholic Church were given control of the building, as the only two churches then officially operating in the [[Manhattan Project]] community. During the war, when Oak Ridge's Manhattan Project facilities were operating around the clock, the chapel building was also in use nearly 24 hours a day as a venue for worship services, [[wedding]]s, and other occasions for local workers of various Protestant, Catholic, and Jewish religious backgrounds.<ref name=pre1980/>
At the peak of wartime activity in Oak Ridge, when the population exceeded 70,000, the United Church employed four ministers and conducted worship services in the Chapel on the Hill, East Village Chapel, and the Jefferson Theater, as well as [[Sunday school]] classes in several local schools and a [[mobile home|trailer]] camp. By 1951, the United Church Chapel-on-the-Hill consolidated as a single [[interdenominational]] congregation, making its home in the Chapel on the Hill building.<ref name=pre1980/>
The United Church congregation purchased the chapel and {{convert|3.72|acre|ha}} of land from the [[U.S. Atomic Energy Commission]] on May 11, 1955 for a price of $17,116.<ref name=pre1980/> An adjoining educational building was added in 1956-1957. The facility continues to operate as a nondenominational Protestant church under lay leadership, employing ministers with backgrounds in [[Mainline (Protestant)|mainstream Protestant]] denominations.<ref>Don Goodwin, [http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=52&Itemid=55 "The United Church" (1980) and "A Unique and Lonely Path" (2007)] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110728093011/http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=52&Itemid=55 |date=July 28, 2011 }}, United Church, Chapel on the Hill website, accessed March 5, 2010</ref> Since 2007 it has been affiliated with the [[Center for Progressive Christianity]].<ref>[http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=175&Itemid=49 The 8 Points of Progressive Christianity] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304033528/http://thechapelonthehill.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=175&Itemid=49 |date=March 4, 2012 }}, United Church, Chapel on the Hill website, accessed March 5, 2010</ref> The church's motto is "Where People from All Denominations Meet in Their Differences, but Are One in Their Search for God."<ref name=churchhistory/>
The Chapel-on-the-Hill was placed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] in 1993 as a [[contributing property]] in the [[Oak Ridge Historic District]].<ref name=NationalRegister/>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.thechapelonthehill.org The United Church, Chapel on the Hill]
{{DEFAULTSORT:United Church, The Chapel On The Hill}} [[Category:Churches in Tennessee]] [[Category:Churches on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee]] [[Category:Oak Ridge, Tennessee]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Anderson County, Tennessee]] [[Category:Military chapels of the United States]] [[Category:Nondenominational Christian churches in Tennessee]] [[Category:Wooden churches in Tennessee]] [[Category:Historic district contributing properties in Tennessee]] [[Category:National Register of Historic Places in Anderson County, Tennessee]]

== Welcome {{PAGENAME}}! == {| style="font-size:95%;" class=toccolours |Hello, {{PAGENAME}}, I'm [[User:Xaosflux|xaosflux]] and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for your contributions. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are a few good links for newcomers: *[[Wikipedia:Simplified Ruleset|The simplified rules of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Help|Help pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] *[[Wikipedia:Picture tutorial|Picture tutorial]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign_your_posts_on_talk_pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date, and use [[Wikipedia:Edit summary|edit summaries]] whenever you change a page. If you have any questions, need help or assistance, check out [[Wikipedia:Ask a question]] or contact me on [[User talk:Xaosflux|my talk page]]. Again, welcome! Enjoy Wikipedia!!  |} — [[User:Xaosflux|xaosflux]] [[User_talk:Xaosflux|Talk]] 19:34, 30 October 2006 (UTC) Your initial userpage was deleted per [[Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/User:Camaro4]]. Please see [[WP:USERPAGE]] for our userpage policy. Thank you, — [[User:Xaosflux|xaosflux]] [[User_talk:Xaosflux|Talk]] 19:34, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

Thank you for experimenting with Wikipedia{{{{{subst|}}}#if:Ethan cavett| by creating the page [[:Ethan cavett]]}}. Your test worked, and the page that you created has been or soon will be deleted. Please use [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|the sandbox]] for any other tests you want to do. Take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome page]] if you would like to learn more about contributing to our encyclopedia. -[[User:FisherQueen|FisherQueen]] 19:34, 30 October 2006 (UTC) Please do not add nonsense to Wikipedia{{#if:Kyle Reese|, as you did to [[:Kyle Reese]]}}. It is considered [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|vandalism]]. If you would like to experiment, use the [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|sandbox]]. Thank you. -[[User:FisherQueen|FisherQueen]] 19:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC) It is felt that the article you created at [[Ethan cavett]] is not suitable for a Wikipedia article, which must have a [[Wikipedia:Notability|notable]] subject and be [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable]]. I have moved it to [[User:{{PAGENAME}}]], which is where users are free to write about themselves. You are at liberty to move it back into the (Main) namespace but bear in mind that if you do so, it is likely to be nominated for deletion. Note, however, that the purpose of a user page is to enable active editors of Wikipedia to introduce themselves to other editors. [[WP:NOT#Wikipedia_is_not_a_blog.2C_webspace_provider.2C_or_social_networking_site|Wikipedia is not a general hosting service]], so your user page is not a personal homepage. Content unrelated to Wikipedia or its editing is likely to be removed. Please see [[WP:User_page|the user page guidelines]], especially [[WP:User_page#What_can_I_not_have_on_my_user_page.3F|this section]] for more information. -- [[User:Omicronpersei8|Omicronpersei8]] ([[User talk:Omicronpersei8|talk]]) 19:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ==[[:Nathan burton]]== A tag has been placed on [[:Nathan burton]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done because the article seems to be about a person, group of people, band, club, company, or web content, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is notable [[Wikipedia:Notability|(see the guidelines for notability here)]]. If you can indicate why the subject of this article is notable, you may contest the tagging. To do this, please affix the template {{tl|hangon}} to the page and leave a note on [[Talk:Nathan burton|the article's talk page]] explaining your position. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself. Please read the [[WP:CSD|criteria for speedy deletion]] (specifically, article #7) and [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|our general biography criteria]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. --[[User:Kinu|Kinu]] [[User_talk:Kinu|''t'']]/[[Special:Contributions/Kinu|''c'']] 19:39, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{original research|date=June 2010}} {{notability|date=June 2010}} }} {{Infobox typeface | name = Archer | image = ArcherSpec.svg | style = [[Serif]] | classifications = [[Slab serif|Humanist slab serif]] | date = 2001 | creator = [[Tobias Frere-Jones]]
[[Jonathan Hoefler]] | foundry = [[Hoefler & Frere-Jones]] }} '''Archer''' is a [[slab serif]] typeface designed in 2001 by [[Tobias Frere-Jones]] and [[Jonathan Hoefler]] for use in ''[[Martha Stewart Living]]'' magazine. It was later released by [[Hoefler & Frere-Jones]] for commercial licensing. ==Structure== The typeface is a [[Slab_serif#Geometric_model|geometric]] slab serif, one with a geometric design similar to sans-serif fonts. It takes inspiration from mid-twentieth century designs such as [[Rockwell (typeface)|Rockwell]]. The face is unique for combining the geometric structure of twentieth-century European slab-serifs but imbuing the face with a domestic, less strident tone of voice. [[Ball terminal|Balls]] were added to the upper terminals on letters such as ''C'' and ''G'' to increase its charm.{{cite web|last1=Devroye|first1=Luc|title=Jonathan Hoefler|url=http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-27370.html|publisher=McGill University|accessdate=29 September 2014}} [[Italic type|Italics]] are true italic designs, with flourishes influenced by calligraphy, an unusual feature for geometric slab serif designs. As with many [[Hoefler & Frere-Jones]] designs, it was released in a wide range of weights from hairline to bold, reflecting its design goal as a typeface for complex magazines.{{cite web|last1=Earls|first1=David John|title=Archer|url=http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/archer/|website=Typographica|accessdate=11 July 2015}} ==Uses== The typeface has been used for, among other things, branding for [[Wells Fargo]] and is a main font for the ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'' and [[Wes Anderson]]'s film ''[[The Grand Budapest Hotel]]''.{{cite web|last1=Adams|first1=Lauren|title=Is Archer's Use on Target?|url=http://www.aiga.org/is-archers-use-on-target/|publisher=AIGI}} It is also the current font used for titles and body text by the [[Design Observer]] website. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100033 Archer] (H&FJ website) [[Category:Hoefler & Frere-Jones typefaces]] [[Category:Typefaces designed by Tobias Frere-Jones]] [[Category:Typefaces designed by Jonathan Hoefler]] [[Category:Typefaces and fonts introduced in 2001]] [[Category:Digital typefaces]] [[Category:Typefaces with text figures]] [[Category:Geometric slab-serif typefaces]] {{typography-stub}}

==Welcome== {| style="border-spacing:8px;margin:0px -8px" width="100%" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #084080; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top;color:#000000;font-size: 85%"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Hello Deloris63! [[Wikipedia:Introduction|Welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Deloris63|your contributions]]. If you decide that you need help, check out ''Getting Help'' below, ask me on my talk page, or place '''{{helpme}}''' on your talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages by clicking [[Image:Button sig2.png]] or using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. Finally, please do your best to '''always fill in the [[Help:Edit summary|edit summary]] field'''. Below are some useful links to facilitate your involvement. Happy Editing! {{Infobox basketball biography | image = | caption = | name = Ricky Minard | position = [[Shooting guard]] / [[Small forward]] | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 5 | weight_lbs = 220 | league = [[Korisliiga]] | team = Tampereen Pyrintö | number = 24 | nationality = American | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|9|11}} | birth_place = [[Mansfield, Ohio]] | high_school = [[Mansfield Senior High School|Mansfield]] (Mansfield, Ohio) | college = [[Morehead State Eagles men's basketball|Morehead State]] (2000–2004) | draft_year = 2004 | draft_round = 2 | draft_pick = 48 | draft_team = [[Sacramento Kings]] | career_start = 2004 | career_end = | years1 = 2004–2005 | team1 = [[Columbus Riverdragons]] | years2 = 2005 | team2 = [[Pallacanestro Biella|Lauretana Biella]] | years3 = 2005–2007 | team3 = [[Pallacanestro Reggiana|Bipop Carire Reggio Emilia]] | years4 = 2007–2009 | team4 = [[Sutor Basket Montegranaro|Premiata Montegranaro]] | years5 = 2009–2010 | team5 = [[Pallacanestro Virtus Roma|Lottomatica Roma]] | years6 = 2010 | team6 = [[BC Khimki|Khimki Moscow Region]] | years7 = 2010–2011 | team7 = [[UNICS Kazan]] | years8 = 2011–2012 | team8 = [[BC Azovmash|Azovmash Mariupol]] | years9 = 2012 | team9 = [[A.S. Junior Pallacanestro Casale|Novipiu Casale]] | years10 = 2012–2013 | team10 = [[Virtus Pallacanestro Bologna|Virtus Bologna]] | years11 = 2013 | team11 = [[Beşiktaş men's basketball team|Beşiktaş]] | years12 = 2013–2014 | team12 = [[BC Budivelnyk|Budivelnyk Kyiv]] | years13 = 2015 | team13 = [[SPO Rouen Basket]] | years14 = 2015 | team14 = [[BG Göttingen]] | years15 = 2015–present | team15 = [[Tampereen Pyrintö (basketball)|Tampereen Pyrintö]] | highlights = * [[Eurocup Basketball|Eurocup]] champion (2011) * [[Ukrainian Basketball League|Ukrainian League]] champion (2014) * [[Ukrainian Basketball Cup|Ukrainian Cup]] champion (2014) }}
'''Ricky Donell Minard Jr.''' (born September 11, 1982) is an American professional [[basketball]] player who plays for [[Tampereen Pyrintö (basketball)|Tampereen Pyrintö]] of the [[Korisliiga]]. He is Morehead State's career scoring leader.<ref name=espn1/>
==Professional career== He was selected by the [[Sacramento Kings]] in the 2nd round (48th overall) of the [[2004 NBA Draft]]. A 6'4" guard from [[Morehead State University]], Minard was signed by the Kings in July 2004, but they waived him in November the same year, and so far he has never appeared in an [[NBA]] game.<ref name=espn1>[http://sports.espn.go.com/nba/news/story?id=1836037 Martin signs for three years, $2.34 million - NBA - ESPN]</ref>
Minard started his professional career with [[Columbus Riverdragons]] of the [[NBDL]].<ref>[http://www.nba.com/dleague/nbdl/draft_041105.html Riverdragons Select Ricky Minard With the No. 1 Overall Pick]</ref> In January 2005, he left the United States and moved to Italy where he spent next five years playing for [[Pallacanestro Biella|Lauretana Biella]], [[Pallacanestro Reggiana|Bipop Carire Reggio Emilia]], [[Sutor Basket Montegranaro|Premiata Montegranaro]] and [[Pallacanestro Virtus Roma|Lottomatica Roma]].<ref>[http://web.legabasket.it/player/?id=MIN-RIC-82 Italian League profile]</ref>
On March 12, 2010, he signed with [[BC Khimki|Khimki Moscow Region]] of Russia for the rest of the season.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/russia/80344/khimki-announces-minard.html Khimki announces Minard]</ref> For the 2010–11 season he stayed in Russia but moved to [[UNICS Kazan]].<ref>[http://www.eurocupbasketball.com/eurocup/news/i/77352/unics-kazan-inks-scorer-minard Unics Kazan inks scorer Minard]</ref> On July 20, 2011, he signed a one-year deal with [[Azovmash Mariupol]] of Ukraine.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/ukraine/87516/azovmash-mariupol-lands-ricky-minard.html Azovmash Mariupol lands Ricky Minard]</ref> On February 17, 2012, he was released by Azovmash.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/ukraine/90270/azovmash-mariupol-released-ricky-minard.html Azovmash Mariupol released Ricky Minard]</ref> The same day he signed with [[A.S. Junior Pallacanestro Casale|Novipiu Casale]] of Italy for the rest of the season.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/italy/serie-a/90279/novipiu-casale-officially-announced-ricky-minard.html Novipiu Casale officially announced Ricky Minard]</ref>
On August 28, 2012, he signed with [[Virtus Pallacanestro Bologna|Virtus Bologna]] of Italy.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/italy/serie-a/94891/virtus-bologna-officially-signs-ricky-minard.html Virtus Bologna officially signs Ricky Minard]</ref> On February 21, 2012, he left Bologna and signed with [[Beşiktaş men's basketball team|Beşiktaş]] of Turkey for the rest of the season.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/italy/serie-a/99414/ricky-minard-virtus-bologna-part-ways.html Ricky Minard, Virtus Bologna part ways]</ref><ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/turkey/99416/besiktas-lands-ricky-minard.html Besiktas lands Ricky Minard]</ref> On July 25, 2013, he signed with [[BC Budivelnyk|Budivelnyk Kyiv]] of Ukraine for the 2013–14 season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Budivelnyk signs Ricky Minard|url=http://www.sportando.net/eng/europe/ukraine/60156/budivelnyk-signs-ricky-minard.html|publisher=Sportando.net|accessdate=July 25, 2013}}</ref>
On January 18, 2015, he signed with French team [[SPO Rouen Basket]].<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/france/149125/rouen-lands-ricky-minard.html Rouen lands Ricky Minard]</ref> On March 7, 2015, he parted ways with Rouen after appearing in five league games.<ref>[http://www.eurobasket.com/France/news/397227/Ricky-Minard-left-Rouen Ricky Minard left Rouen]</ref>
On August 20, 2015, he signed with [[BG Göttingen]] of Germany.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/germany/173349/bg-goettingen-lands-ricky-minard.html BG Goettingen lands Ricky Minard]</ref> On October 23, 2015, he parted ways due to injury with Göttingen after appearing in two games.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/germany/179583/bg-goettingen-ricky-minard-part-ways.html BG Goettingen, Ricky Minard part ways]</ref> On November 13, 2015, he signed with [[Tampereen Pyrintö (basketball)|Tampereen Pyrintö]] of the Finnish [[Korisliiga]].<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/finland/181864/ricky-minard-inks-with-tampere-pyrinto.html Ricky Minard inks with Tampere Pyrinto]</ref> Pyrintö advanced to Korisliiga Finals, where they lost to [[Kouvot]]. Following their mutual interest already from the previous season the parties re-signed on August 15, 2016.<ref>[http://pyrinto.fi/ricky-minard-pukee-punaista-paalle/ Ricky Minard pukee punaista päälle] Tampereen Pyrintö Basketball {{fi}}</ref>
==Notes== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://aol.nba.com/draft2004/profiles/RickyMinard.html NBA.com Draft bio] * [http://www.collegehoopsnet.com/Draft/Prospects/RMinard.htm Interview] * [http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/gamecent/p/pid/6026023/playerview.html FIBA.com profile] * [http://www.basslinespin.com/MinardRicky.htm Who is Ricky Minard?] * [http://basketball.eurobasket.com/player/Ricky_Minard/46336 Eurobasket.com profile]

No further edits should be made to this page. '' The result was '''redirect''' to [[The Mikado]]. -- [[User:Jitse Niesen|Jitse Niesen]] ([[User talk:Jitse Niesen|talk]]) 11:59, 8 November 2006 (UTC) ===[[Katisha]]=== Contains no information not in [[The Mikado]] article, the point of the spin-off unclear, as the character only appears in one opera, and it's unclear how this could expand further. In normal circumstances I'd say merge or make it a redirect, but, as I said, everything IS covered in [[The Mikado]], and I can't imagine someone searching for "Katisha". [[User:Adam Cuerden|Adam Cuerden]] [[User_talk:Adam Cuerden|talk]] 19:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' article per nomination. Anything notable about this character should appear in the plot summary of ''[[The Mikado]]''. There is no reason to have a separate article for this character. -- [[User:Ssilvers|Ssilvers]] 19:59, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Redirect''' it to [[The Mikado]] -- merge isn't needed since the info's there, but the redirect could be useful -- somebody could search for it. -- [[User:ArglebargleIV|ArglebargleIV]] 22:15, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Note''': This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Japan|list of Japan-related deletions]]. -- [[User:Qiszxo|Qiszxo]] 08:11, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Redirect''' to [[The Mikado]]. It seems the creator of the article has abandoned it, too. [[User:KrakatoaKatie|'''Krakatoa''']][[User talk:KrakatoaKatie|Katie]] 23:45, 6 November 2006 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

revision.comment: Robot - Replacing image Wikisigbutton.png with Button sig2.png
revision.text:
{| class="wikitable" |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Hello</center> <center>Bonjour</center> <center>Buenos días</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center><font size=4>{{PAGENAME}}</font></center>
<center>and...</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Welcome</center> <center>Bienvenue</center> <center>Bienvenido/Bienvenida</center> |- | colspan="3" | <center><font size=5>to [[Wikipedia]], the free encyclopedia!</font></center> |- | colspan="3" | Wikipedia is a free-content encyclopedia [[m:List of Wikipedias|written in 250 languages]] by thousands of users like you and me from all walks of life. As a member of the [[WP:Wc|Welcoming Committee]], I would like to say thanks for being a part of this project.
Here are some links to help you, the new user, on your Wikipedia journey:
*[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Introduction]] *[[Wikipedia:Sandbox|Sandbox]] *[[Help:Editing|Editing a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Bootcamp|Bootcamp]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|Five pillars]]
Whether you're new to the project or have helped us for a while, remember to use [[Help:Edit summary|edit summaries]] when you're done with a page. Summaries are important because, with those, other editors will understand what you have done with the content. '''REMEMBER''': think twice before clicking "'''Save page'''" below the editing box, since whatever you write in the summary box will permamently go in the [[Help:Page history|history of any page]]. (Spellchecking is important; you cannot change the summary data after you have finished editing.)
Remember, also, to sign your name with four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) or by pressing this button ([[Image:Button sig2.png|Signature button]]) above the box, whenever leaving comments on [[Wikipedia:Talk page|talk pages]].
If you want to know how you're doing on Wikipedia, feel free to check out [[Special:Contributions/Kdubbz|your list of contributions]].
If you don't know how to do something, type <nowiki>{{helpme}}</nowiki> on your talk page, and [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrators]] will come to solve your problems.
After you've stayed here for a while, you might want to take an [[Wikipedia:Editor review|editor review]], or, even better, take a chance at [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship|adminship]].
Wherever the journey takes you, I wish you the best of luck and respect on Wikipedia. If you have any questions about my expertise or this site, you can [[Special:Emailuser/Slgrandson|e-mail me]] or [[User talk:Slgrandson|talk to me]], and I will see about the situation as best as possible.
In the meantime, happy editing!
<div style="text-align: right;">Slgr<font color="#228B22">[[Wikipedia:Esperanza|@]]</font>ndson <small>([[User:Slgrandson|page]] - [[User talk:Slgrandson|messages]] - [[Special:Contributions/Slgrandson|contribs]])</small> 19:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC)<div> |}

revision.text: ==[[:Nonamaker]]== A tag has been placed on [[:Nonamaker]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done because the article seems to be about a person, group of people, band, club, company, or web content, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is notable [[Wikipedia:Notability|(see the guidelines for notability here)]]. If you can indicate why the subject of this article is notable, you may contest the tagging. To do this, please affix the template {{tl|hangon}} to the page and leave a note on [[Talk:Nonamaker|the article's talk page]] explaining your position. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself. Please read the [[WP:CSD|criteria for speedy deletion]] (specifically, article #7) and [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|our general biography criteria]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. [[User:Elomis|Elomis]] 19:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC) == Waterboarding == Could you post a link where somebody calls [[surfing]] [[waterboarding]]? I can't seem to find any. [[User:Jehochman|Jehochman]] [[User talk:Jehochman|Talk]] 00:46, 26 April 2009 (UTC) Yes, Waterboarding is a very common term in Hawaii, the Western US, Australia and even some former Soviet countries. Here's a link to an article where the author references this http://mydailyclarity.com/2009/03/surfing-for-peace-in-the-gaza/. Also, I found a site that references waterboarding here http://www.hawaiiansouthshore.com/shop/product.php?productid=17375. It get's confusing; I was looking for 'surfing' but we call it Waterboarding so I got to the wrong page ;-) : Fair enough. That source uses "water boarding" with a space. I've made a change to your edit to reflect the space. [[User:Jehochman|Jehochman]] [[User talk:Jehochman|Talk]] 01:23, 26 April 2009 (UTC)

revision.text:
{| class="wikitable" |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Hello</center> <center>Bonjour</center> <center>Buenos días</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center><font size=4>{{PAGENAME}}</font></center>
<center>and...</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Welcome</center> <center>Bienvenue</center> <center>Bienvenido/Bienvenida</center> |- | colspan="3" | <center><font size=5>to [[Wikipedia]], the free encyclopedia!</font></center> |- | colspan="3" | Wikipedia is a free-content encyclopedia [[m:List of Wikipedias|written in 250 languages]] by thousands of users like you and me from all walks of life. As a member of the [[WP:Wc|Welcoming Committee]], I would like to say thanks for being a part of this project.
Here are some links to help you, the new user, on your Wikipedia journey:
*[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Introduction]] *[[Wikipedia:Sandbox|Sandbox]] *[[Help:Editing|Editing a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Bootcamp|Bootcamp]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|Five pillars]]
Whether you're new to the project or have helped us for a while, remember to use [[Help:Edit summary|edit summaries]] when you're done with a page. Summaries are important because, with those, other editors will understand what you have done with the content. '''REMEMBER''': think twice before clicking "'''Save page'''" below the editing box, since whatever you write in the summary box will permamently go in the [[Help:Page history|history of any page]]. (Spellchecking is important; you cannot change the summary data after you have finished editing.)
Remember, also, to sign your name with four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) or by pressing this button ([[Image:Button sig2.png|Signature button]]) above the box, whenever leaving comments on [[Wikipedia:Talk page|talk pages]].
If you want to know how you're doing on Wikipedia, feel free to check out [[Special:Contributions/AlexYong|your list of contributions]].
If you don't know how to do something, type <nowiki>{{helpme}}</nowiki> on your talk page, and [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrators]] will come to solve your problems.
After you've stayed here for a while, you might want to take an [[Wikipedia:Editor review|editor review]], or, even better, take a chance at [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship|adminship]].
Wherever the journey takes you, I wish you the best of luck and respect on Wikipedia. If you have any questions about my expertise or this site, you can [[Special:Emailuser/Slgrandson|e-mail me]] or [[User talk:Slgrandson|talk to me]], and I will see about the situation as best as possible.
In the meantime, happy editing!
<div style="text-align: right;">Slgr<font color="#228B22">[[Wikipedia:Esperanza|@]]</font>ndson <small>([[User:Slgrandson|page]] - [[User talk:Slgrandson|messages]] - [[Special:Contributions/Slgrandson|contribs]])</small> 19:37, 30 October 2006 (UTC)<div> |}

{{Infobox tennis biography | image = Alex Peya (20936902906).jpg | name = Alexander Peya | country = {{AUT}} | residence = [[Vienna]], Austria | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1980|6|27}} | birth_place = Vienna, Austria | height = {{height|m=1.82|precision=0}} | turnedpro = 1998 | plays = Right-handed (one-handed backhand) | careerprizemoney = US$3,709,784 | singlesrecord = 22–51 | singlestitles = 0 | highestsinglesranking = No. 92 (April 30, 2007) | currentsinglesranking = | AustralianOpenresult = | FrenchOpenresult = 1R ([[2004 French Open|2004]], [[2007 French Open|2007]]) | Wimbledonresult = 2R ([[2004 Wimbledon Championships|2004]]) | USOpenresult = 3R ([[2004 US Open (tennis)|2004]]) | doublesrecord = 317–229 | doublestitles = 15 | highestdoublesranking = No. 3 (12 August 2013) | currentdoublesranking = No. 26 (3 April 2017) | AustralianOpenDoublesresult = 3R ([[2014 Australian Open – Men's Doubles|2014]]) | FrenchOpenDoublesresult = SF ([[2013 French Open – Men's Doubles|2013]], [[2016 French Open – Men's Doubles|2016]]) | WimbledonDoublesresult = SF ([[2011 Wimbledon Championships – Men's Doubles|2011]]) | USOpenDoublesresult = F ([[2013 US Open – Men's Doubles|2013]]) | OthertournamentsDoubles = Yes | MastersCupDoublesresult = SF ([[2013 ATP World Tour Finals – Doubles|2013]]) | OlympicsDoublesresult = 2R ([[Tennis at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's doubles|2012]]) | Mixed = yes | mixedtitles = 0 | AustralianOpenMixedresult = QF ([[2015 Australian Open – Mixed Doubles|2015]]) | FrenchOpenMixedresult = QF ([[2015 French Open – Mixed Doubles|2015]]) | WimbledonMixedresult = F ([[2015 Wimbledon Championships – Mixed Doubles|2015]]) | USOpenMixedresult = 2R ([[2014 US Open – Mixed Doubles|2014]]) | updated = 3 April 2017 }} '''Alexander Peya''' (born 27 June 1980) is an [[Austria]]n male [[tennis]] player. He reached a career-high singles ranking of world no. 92 in April 2007. His career-high doubles ranking is world no. 3, first achieved in August 2013. He was born in [[Vienna]], Austria, and currently resides there. In September 2008 Peya helped [[Austria Davis Cup team|Austria]] to a [[Davis Cup]] play-off win against [[Great Britain Davis Cup team|Great Britain]]. Peya beat [[Alex Bogdanovic]] in four sets in the deciding rubber of the tie. ==Significant finals== ===Grand Slam finals=== ====Doubles: 1 (1 runner-up)==== {| class="wikitable" ! Outcome ! revision.text: {{WikiProject Biography |living=yes |class=Stub |sports-priority=Low |listas=Fry, Nick |sports-work-group=yes }} ==Untitled== I removed "2006 is only his second full season as a team-manager. It took other team managers, such as [[Frank Williams]] many years to win a grand prix as manager." This suggests Fry is responsible for a dramatic turnaround in the team's performance - their 2005 and 2006 performances have been widely acknowledged to have been poor to middling. the circumstances of the Hungarian GP were also exceptional. [[User:Mark83|Mark83]] 19:37, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ::It has been reported in the Telegraph (http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/motorsport/formulaone/5369856/Monaco-Grand-Prix-Jenson-Buttons-playboy-days-behind-him.html) that Nick Fry owns a proportion of the team, and in an earlier article, that he owns the majority stake. Shouldn't this be added? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/92.239.225.23|92.239.225.23]] ([[User talk:92.239.225.23|talk]]) 23:17, 28 May 2009 (UTC)

== Blatant vandalism ==
[[Image:Stop hand.svg|left|30px]] Welcome to Wikipedia. We invite everyone to contribute constructively to our encyclopedia. Take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome page]] if you would like to learn more about contributing. However, unconstructive edits{{#if:{{{1|}}}|, such as those you made to [[:{{{1}}}]],}} are considered [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|vandalism]]. If you continue in this manner you may be '''[[Wikipedia:blocking policy|blocked]] from editing without further warning'''. [[File:Klein-Glienicke Schweizerhaus 1.jpg|thumb|320px|''Schweizerhaus'' in [[Klein Glienicke]] near [[Berlin]], designed by [[Ferdinand von Arnim]], 1867]] '''Swiss chalet style''' ({{lang-de|Schweizerstil}}, {{lang-no|Sveitserstil}}) is an [[architectural style]] of [[Historicism (art)|Late Historicism]], originally inspired by rural [[chalet]]s in [[Switzerland]] and the [[Alps|Alpine]] (mountainous) regions of [[Central Europe]]. The style refers to traditional building designs characterised by widely projecting roofs and facades richly decorated with wooden balconies and carved ornaments. It spread over [[German Empire|Germany]], [[Austria-Hungary]] and [[Scandinavia]] during the ''[[Belle Époque]]'' era.
==History== [[File:Villa Fridheim, Krøderen, 2.jpg|thumb|Villa Fridheim in [[Krødsherad]], Norway]] Swiss chalet style originated in the [[German Romanticism|Romantic]] era of the late-18th/early-19th century, when the ideas of the [[English landscape garden]] inspired parks and residences in Germany, such as the [[Dessau-Wörlitz Garden Realm]]. It became highly appreciated on the continent by noble landowners who were impressed by the "simple life" of people living in the mountains.
The chalet style soon spread over the German ''[[Mittelgebirge]]'' landscapes such as the [[Harz]] mountains or the [[Dresden]] area and the adjacent [[North Bohemia]]n region. As a "modern" building style, it also influenced the [[resort architecture]] along the [[Baltic Sea|Baltic]] seaside, like in [[Binz]] or [[Heringsdorf, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern|Heringsdorf]]. Around 1900, design elements were used in the construction of numerous bourgeois family homes as well as by notable architects like [[Heinrich von Ferstel]] to build larger mansions and hotels.
The style was further popularized by the first waves of tourism of rich people from the North and West of Europe and became popular in other parts of Europe and North America, notably in the [[architecture of Norway]], [[architecture of Iceland|Iceland]] and [[Architecture of the Netherlands|the Netherlands]] and in the [[country house]] architecture of [[architecture of Sweden|Sweden]] and [[Cincinnati, Ohio|Cincinnati (Ohio, USA)]], in the late 19th and early 20th century. English examples of the chalet style include the [[Boathouse at Belton House]], [[Lincolnshire]], by [[Anthony Salvin]] and the Swiss Cottage at [[Osbourne House]], on the [[Isle of Wight]], constructed for [[Queen Victoria]]'s children.
==Characteristics== The style is characterized by: *[[Gabled roof|Gabled roofs]] with wide [[eaves]] *Exposed construction beams, including large [[Bracket (architecture)|brackets]] *Decorative carving and mouldings *[[Balconies]] *Large windows *[[Weatherboarding]], usually painted, often in bright colors
<gallery> File:ER-Burgberg-old-villa.jpg|Villa in [[Erlangen]] File:Villa Eschebach Weißer Hirsch Dresden.JPG|Villa Eschebach in [[Dresden]] Kviknes hotel.jpg|[[Kviknes Hotel]] in [[Balestrand]], Norway, planned by [[Franz Wilhelm Schiertz]] in 1894 Valkenburg-Neerhem 68 (1).JPG|Hotel Rooding in [[Valkenburg aan de Geul|Valkenburg]] (1892), designed by [[Pierre Cuypers]] </gallery>
==See also== *[[Victorian architecture]] *[[Carpenter Gothic]] *[[Norvell House]] *[[Timeline of architectural styles]]
==References== *[http://www.cincinnati-oh.gov/cdap/pages/-3783-/ Cincinnati Swiss Chalet houses] *[http://www.husbyggeren.no/sveitser.htm Norwegian description of Swiss Chalet style] *[http://www.housemouse.net/houseplanmonth06.htm#plan DESIGN I. Swiss Chalet, P. F. Robinson, architect, 1827. no online picture]

'' The result was '''delete'''. -- [[User:Jitse Niesen|Jitse Niesen]] ([[User talk:Jitse Niesen|talk]]) 12:28, 8 November 2006 (UTC) :In case anybody requires an explanation how I arrived at this decision, as it is a bit borderline: There seems to be only one reliable source, an article repeated in USA Today and other media. FOOL! This is one of the most promising youngster! HAVE YOU EVER SEEN ANY VIDEOS?? Ahahah you're fool! You are demolishing every article of top-level youngster in this Jimbopedia! How sick. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 19:43, 30 October 2006 (UTC) **Please be [[WP:CIVIL|civil]] to other editors, some of your language is highly inappropriate [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 00:07, 31 October 2006 (UTC) * '''Keep''' Google turns up 26,000 hits with his name. He has his own website and I also found a number of newspaper articles about him. --[[User:Pinkkeith|Pinkkeith]] 19:44, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *This discussion has been included in [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Football|WikiProject Football]]'s list of football (soccer) related deletions. [[User:BlueValour|BlueValour]] 19:56, 30 October 2006 (UTC) * '''Delete''' - he's ten years old, for crying out loud. If he makes it as a pro then add him in but not until then. [[User:Qwghlm|Qwghlm]] 20:09, 30 October 2006 (UTC) **'''Comment''' You can't delete or not delete an article purely based on age. --[[User:Pinkkeith|Pinkkeith]] 20:11, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ***'''Comment''' - the point is that he doesn't meet [[WP:BIO]]. There are thousands of kids with potential; they get articles here when that potential is realised by playing for the first team of a significant club. WP is not a crystal ball. [[User:BlueValour|BlueValour]] 20:53, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ****'''Comment''' Well, that wasn't the point that you made, but it does pass [[WP:BIO]] based on [[WP:GOOGLE]]. There is no crystal ball to this article at all, it is all based on present information and known fact. --[[User:Pinkkeith|Pinkkeith]] 21:00, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *****'''Comment''' What "known fact?" There is not a single source cited in the entire article. I am particularly leery of this becoming another AFD where the article is kept because of references cited in the AFD discussion that never make it into the article thus defeating the entire purpose of this discussion and [[WP:V]]. --[[User:ElKevbo|ElKevbo]] 14:26, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *We can, however, '''delete''' an article if no reliable sources are provided when challenged under [[WP:V|verifiability policy]]. Pinkkeith, can you point us to featured coverage in mainstream media? Some of those are needed to let us keep the article. Being signed to a youth team isn't notable enough to get thousands of other kids their own WP articles. [[User:Barno|Barno]] 20:39, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ** Here is a [http://www.usatoday.com/money/industries/technology/maney/2005-02-01-maney_x.htm USA Today article] on him. In there the writer mentions that he was covered in numerous other newspapers. --[[User:Pinkkeith|Pinkkeith]] 20:43, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *** - fine but he has achieved nothing in the adult world - the press references are the result of a splendid publicity campaign for his video but that doesn't confer notability. [[User:BlueValour|BlueValour]] 20:57, 30 October 2006 (UTC) **** That's blatent [[ephebiphobia]]. Reread the article, the entire article is talking about the video and how it made him notable. --[[User:Pinkkeith|Pinkkeith]] 21:01, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Strong keep''' per [[WP:BIO]]. [http://news.google.com/archivesearch?q=%22Jean+Carlos+Chera%22&btnG=Search+Archives&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8 Google News Archive] search yields 74 unique hits- more than enough to qualify as "the primary subject of multiple non-trivial published works whose source is independent of the person." How old the subject is and the method in which he was made notable isn't relevant; the subject meets [[WP:BIO]]. --[[User talk:Rory096|Rory096]] 21:14, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :*'''Comment''' - most of the content, apart from his birthdate, fails [[WP:V]]. The Ghits mean we can keep the article not that we must. They are all the result of a single video being published on the internet and they have all picked up the same story. Example of the content "He has recently claimed that he dreams to play for FC Barcelona and his favourite player is Ronaldinho." We used to attempt to be a serious encyclopaedia. [[User:BlueValour|BlueValour]] 16:58, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete'''-So he's a child prodigy, that doesn't make him notable. Some of my friends are amazing at basketball, but they don't have any articles. As above, if he makes it to the pros (or college, if Brazil has a college league, I dunno), then we can always repost. '''''[[User:DoomsDay349|Dooms]][[User talk:DoomsDay349|Day]][[User:DoomsDay349/Esperanza|349]]''''' '''Happy Halloween!''' 21:39, 30 October 2006 (UTC) **You're absolutely right, being a child prodigy does not make him notable. However, having over 70 news articles about him ''does''. --[[User talk:Rory096|Rory096]] 00:13, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' When he has played for Manchester United, Arsenal, Porto, Eindhoven or Real Madrid he will have earned his article. Until then it is worth remembering that, at least in the UK, it would be highly improper for professional clubs to express an interest in a 10 year old, let alone to 'openly court' them. [[User:Emeraude|Emeraude]] 22:06, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' per nom, and Emeraude. [[User:Postdlf|Postdlf]] 23:06, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' per nom. [[User:HornetMike|HornetMike]] 23:43, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *Absolutely '''delete''', has not achieved anything serious in football, and might be burnt out by the time he's 12 :-) [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 00:07, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' I've reviewed some of these news articles. I can read only the English ones, which are basically the same novelty one-shot story, repeated, or something like the USA today story, which is more about how everyone is famous on the Internet than a biographical source for an article. Doesn't meet the thrust of [[WP:BIO]]. [[User:Demi|Demi]] [[User_talk:Demi|T]]/[[Special:Contributions/Demi|C]] 00:34, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Keep''' but the entry should be moved away from that of a professional footballer, and skewed more towards 21st century curiosity [[User:Superlinus|Superlinus]] 12:07, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Keep''' as per Superlinus. [[User:Alii h|aLii]] 14:04, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Strong delete''', miserably fails [[WP:BIO]], as well as [[WP:NOT|Wikipedia is not a crystal ball]]. – [[User:Johan Elisson|Elisson]] • [[User talk:Johan Elisson|T]] • [[Special:Contributions/Johan Elisson|C]] • 16:41, 31 October 2006 (UTC) **Can you please explain how it fails [[WP:BIO]]? It seems to quite clearly meet it to me. --[[User talk:Rory096|Rory096]] 20:31, 3 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Strong delete''', as per [[User:Johan Elisson|Johan Elisson]]. 17:15, 31 October 2006 (UTC) '''Keep''' this is classic wikipedia group dynamics trying to destroy this young mans article who is being called the next [[pele]]. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Portillo|Portillo]] ([[User talk:Portillo|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Portillo|contribs]]) I also think that it shouldnt matter weather he plays at the top level. Thats bias because we also include players names from 3rd divisions, or from lesser countries. This kid is at [[Santos FC]] now i believe, which means hes playing for a good team. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Portillo|Portillo]] ([[User talk:Portillo|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Portillo|contribs]]) :He doesn't play for the Santos first team, though. Or are you suggesting that any kid who's a member of the Under-11 team of Manchester United, Real Madrid, etc, should get a WP article.....? [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 09:41, 2 November 2006 (UTC) ::If they're talented, they already have a BBC article, they're everywere considered as a worldwide prospected youngster, yes. You are deleting all the top-youngsters article, shame on you man. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 10:24, 2 November 2006 (UTC) :::If you look higher up this page you'll see that it wasn't me that nominated this article, so please don't make uncivil comments aimed solely at me [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 10:28, 2 November 2006 (UTC) ::::So, shame on you and your friend. I'm not making uncivil comments, YOU (yeah yeah and your friend) are making uncivil actions here. Let's delete Giovanni dos Santos and Mati Fernandez...c'mon! Who the hell are them?? Had they win a Ballon d'Or? Are they [[David Beckham|supermodel overpaid untalented footballers]]? Delete'em! What are you waiting for?? You're (plural) just football-ignorants who are destroying basis of football here in Jimbopedia. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 10:37, 2 November 2006 (UTC) :::::[[Mati Fernandez]] doesn't appear to have an article to delete.... [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 14:53, 2 November 2006 (UTC) Wouldnt adding the sources such as the times and guardian, while linking to his videos from youtube help the article? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Portillo|Portillo]] ([[User talk:Portillo|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Portillo|contribs]]) :I'm not sure about YouTube, as anyone can put their own videos on there and that wouldn't necessarily demonstrate notability outside his own family. Citing mainstream media sources would help, though [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 14:51, 2 November 2006 (UTC) ::[[Matías Fernández|This]] is the demonstration that you are only a football-ignorant who doesn't know what he's doing, and he's doing this just because of his ignorance. How sick. You don't know what are you deleting, man. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 19:40, 2 November 2006 (UTC) :::You've already been asked to cease your [[WP:NPA|uncivil remarks and personal attacks]]. It's unnecessary and unwelcome. And it most certainly isn't convincing anyone to "vote" as you did in this AfD discussion. --[[User:ElKevbo|ElKevbo]] 22:22, 2 November 2006 (UTC) ::::You haven't understood anything. I said to delete it! I'm not tryin' to convince anyone. And, however, it seems there are many youngster-supporters here. Again, I'm not making uncivil remarks or personal attacks, I'm just speaking frankly and your (plural) football-ignorance is clearly demonstrated. Next time I'll delete [[Adolf Hitler]] because of his NN and then I'll complain for the insults... --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 10:53, 3 November 2006 (UTC) :::Also, you can't compare the article on a player who has played nearly 70 matches in the top professional league of a country with a ten year old child who plays for a youth team - one clearly meets [[WP:BIO]], the other clearly doesn't.... [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 08:12, 3 November 2006 (UTC) http://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=carlos+chera please watch the kid if you havent yet seen him, and i believe this type of article is similar to the internet phenomenons or notable youtubers articles [[Portillo]] ::The articles on notable YouTubers such as [[Geriatric1927]] cite sources which show where their YouTube activities were detailed in the mainstream media - if the claim is now that this particular article should be kept because Chera has achieved some form of "internet celebrity" then such sources need to be added to this article too.... [[User:ChrisTheDude|ChrisTheDude]] 09:04, 3 November 2006 (UTC) Maybe we simply need time to fix the article because clearly the mainstream sources can be located, also i found a blog which might help with the whole generation-y web 2.0 crap that youtube is about. [[portillo]] http://jeancarlosfootball.blogspot.com/ i also found his official biography http://www.cherasite.com/bio.html *'''Strong Delete''' YouTube is not a source as per Wiki policy (ditto blog sites, and self promotional Ghits). Wiki is [[WP:NOT|not]] for crystal balling [[User:Doktorbuk|doktorb]] [[User talk:Doktorbuk|words]][[Special:Contributions/Doktorbuk|deeds]] 14:44, 3 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Strong Delete:''' He is a kid. He has made no professional appearances / international appearances (the legality if he had would be questionable). 15:13, 3 November 2006 (UTC) Many of the users are very bias against the idea of a 7yr old having its own article or the fact that his only a child prodigy, but indeed we have a child prodigy article. [[portillo]] :Unfortunately I'm Italian. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 16:39, 4 November 2006 (UTC) ::Off the top of my head - me, ChrisTheDude, Qwghlm and Oldelpaso are British, Ellisson's Swedish. So there goes that theory. [[User:HornetMike|HornetMike]] 09:07, 5 November 2006 (UTC) :::'''Comment'''For the record, I am British. [[User:Kurt000|Kurt000]] 13:05, 5 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' as per [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Christian Maldini|Maldini's 9-years-old son]] AfD. No more notable than him, in my opinion. --[[User:Angelo.romano|Angelo]] 00:54, 6 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Comment''' - I think most of the delete (and some of the keep) votes are completely missing the point. Of course this kid isn't a notable footballer. He is however notable as an internet/media phenomenon. Wikipedia has plenty of articles for such people, as an example go look at [[Mahir Çağrı]]. Then at the bottom of his page have a look at the categories he's placed in. When someone comes to Wikipedia and searches for "that kid i saw clips of on TV" or "that kid my mate sent me videos of" and who's name give 35,000 google hits... He should be here! [[User:Alii h|aLii]] 15:20, 6 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Keep''' per norm. [[User:Minfo|м info]] 23:03, 7 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete''' - I wonder if there is a misunderstanding here? If you are a child prodigy as a piano player you can play the piano. If you are a child prodigy as a mathematician you can do complicated sums in your head. Here, the kid undoubtedly has unusual ball skills but that doesn't make him a footballer. I also don't see him as a 'internet/media phenomenon' with any longevity - with YouTube such phenonima come and go like snow in the sun. [[User:TerriersFan|TerriersFan]] 00:01, 8 November 2006 (UTC) :He was born as a YouTube phenomen but now he's known by all of the users above, has google entries and BBC articles. Guys, you wanna delete him, let's do it. Simply there are people who search for him and people who know him, there are many articles on paper magazines about him, but if you are too zealous to keep a 9-years-old top-youngster 'cause "well, dear Watson, it fails WP:BIO =_= ahem" let's do it. Do it and stop arguing bullshits. --[[User:Necronudist|necronudist]] 09:24, 8 November 2006 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=May 2015}} The '''European Federation of [[Financial Analyst]]s Societies''' ('''EFFAS''')[http://www.effas.com] is the federation of [[financial analyst|analysts]] associations in Europe. EFFAS comprises 27 member societies representing more than 14,000 investment professionals. EFFAS was founded in 1962 and the headquarters is located in [[Frankfurt]], [[Germany]].
Besides its European training programme CEFA (Certified European Financial Analyst) EFFAS also grants the Certified International Investment Analysts (CIIA) designation, ensuring professional qualification by offering global as well as local market knowledge within its examination structure. As a global designation the exams can be taken in different languages. Through the national member societies EFFAS provides a full range of services for capital market experts.
==CIIA Certification== EFFAS participates in further developing the [[Certified International Investment Analyst]] (CIIA) examinations, a financial analyst designation recognised globally. Analysts who belong to European analyst associations that are members of EFFAS, are eligible to participate in the final CIIA examination, if they pass the foundation and the national exams, or if they hold the Certified European Financial Analyst diploma (CEFA).

revision.text: Big Andy, (Andrew Walsh) was born in Louisville, Ky., on Feb. 12, 1978. His father, Frank Walsh and mother, Marsha Sils were overly delighted to have him, since their first son, Patrick, was a dud. Big Andy was known through his childhood as being pretty funny. His brother, not so much. His parents divorced in 1981, after his father recuperated from emergency brain surgery, after falling through the roof at his work and landing head first on the concrete below. He continued to work there until he passed away after a 3 year battle with melanoma, in 2006, a week before his 54th birthday. His mom remarried and had another child, a daughter named Brittani (Gamble).

revision.text: {{Redirect|WP:SCI||Wikipedia:WikiProject Science}} {{rejected}} Ideas related to science are an important part of any comprehensive [[WP:ENC|encyclopedia]]. This guideline and its criteria are intended for use in determining whether a topic is notable due to being a part of or related to science. The tests in this guideline are intended to be fairly rigirous so that a topic that is acceptable under this guideline can be considered an appropriate part of Wikipedia. However, the failure of a topic to meet this guideline's criteria does not automatically exclude it, as it may attain notability through [[WP:N]] itself or another of its subsidiary guidelines. ==Notability of topics related to science== The need for this guideline comes from there being a set of topics which do not fail the test of the [[Wikipedia:No original research|No original research]] policy or the [[Wikipedia:Attribution]] policy but which none the less are not appropriate to Wikipedia because they do have sufficient notability. Such topics mostly represent new findings and theories, as well as past findings and theories that have failed to gain significant attention in either scientific circles or the public at large (or so far failed to gain said attention). A key element to understanding this guideline is that Wikipedia is an encyclopedia, not a research publication, and as such Wikipedia does not usurp the usual validation processes of scientific institutions such as [[peer review]], [[scientific consensus]], and academic recognition. Decisions about including or excluding material must always reflect the opinions of outside authorities, not those of Wikipedia editors. Inclusion or exclusion is therefore not a judgement on the validity, importance or accuracy of a scientific contribution, but simply a reflection of the quality and quantity of responses it received inside and outside the [[scientific community]]. This [[WP:N|notability guideline]] derives its relevance from the policies [[WP:NOT|What Wikipedia is not]] (in particular [[WP:NOT#IINFO|Not an indiscriminate collection of information]] and [[WP:NOT#CRYSTALBALL|Not a crystal ball]]), [[WP:NOR|No original research]] and [[WP:NPOV|Neutral point of view]] (in particular [[WP:NPOV#Undue weight|Undue weight]] and [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/FAQ#Pseudoscience|Pseudoscience]]), as well as the guidelines [[Wikipedia:Conflict of interest|Conflict of interest]] and [[WP:AUTO|Autobiography]]. Also of importance are [[WP:V|verifiability]] and [[WP:RS|reliability]] policies. ==Criteria== === General === In general, a contribution in the field of science is notable enough to merit inclusion in Wikipedia if it meets at least one of the following criteria: #'''Textbook science.''' There is regular non-incidental mention of the contribution in general or specialized textbooks published by reputable presses.{{ref|1|1}} #'''Widely cited.''' Papers covering the contribution have been widely cited{{ref|2|2}} in its research field{{ref|3|3}} relative to other papers in the same area. Self-citations, and citations in journals which are not respected within the relevant research field should be excluded. #'''Press and fiction.''' It is or was well known due to extensive press coverage, or due to being a recurrent theme in notable works of [[fiction]]. In this case the article should make note of this status. A single article on the theory, even if from a major media source such as ''[[New Scientist]]'' or ''[[Scientific American]]'', is not a sufficient criterion. #'''Historical interest.''' It has historically met any of the above criteria within the scientific community or the culture at large but has since either been [[superseded scientific theory|superseded]], disregarded, or dismissed by the scientific community or the culture at large. The article should make note of the subject's status in this regard. #'''Popular belief.''' It is or was believed to be true by a significant part of the general population, even if rejected by scientific authorities. Notable topics which are primarily non-scientific in nature but which contain claims concerning scientific phenomena, should not be handled as scientific. For example, the ''[[Book of Genesis]]'' itself is primarily covered as a religious scripture rather than as a cosmology. On the other hand, subjects such as [[creationism]] or [[creation science]], which involve a direct conflict between scientific and religious doctrine, are properly evaluated both on a scientific and theological basis. Similarly, subjects purporting to have a scientific basis may be noteworthy primarily on cultural or sociological bases, such as UFOs, which can usefully be discussed from several different perspectives. :{{Seealso|Wikipedia:Notability (science)/Irrelevant arguments}} ===Scientific terms=== :''See also [[Wikipedia:Avoid neologisms]] A scientific term is considered notable and worthy of inclusion in Wikipedia if the following can be established: # A commonly agreed-upon formal or informal definition # A trajectory of use for the term in the scientific literature from [[WP:RS|reliable]] and [[WP:V|verifiable]] sources To determine notability it is important to keep in mind that different fields sometimes use the same term to describe different concepts. On the other hand, especially in the early stages of a field, terminology is often not standardized and different terms are used for the same concept. The policy on [[WP:NAME|naming conventions]] gives more information on the choice of the proper term when more than one term is used in the scientific literature. == Assessing the reliability and relevance of sources == Journals from which citations and evidence of notability are obtained are expected to be well known and respected within the relevant research field. The previous requirement of citation from a peer-reviewed source is not alone sufficient by this requirement. (Peer review is done just as easily by a fringe science journal as by a leading journal, while [[Nature (journal)|Nature magazine]], one of the most respected [[scientific journals]] in existence, uses editorial as well as peer review for submissions.) Textbooks should either be well-known and respected or produced by a reputable scientific publisher (which is most likely the same publisher as one or more respected journals). Journals from scientific societies of developing countries are occasionally not reliable. If a finding in such a journal should prove to be of great scientific interest, that finding is often reprinted and/or reported in reliable scientific sources. In such a case, the original journal article can be cited as a primary source, but its relevance should be backed up by secondary citations in known reliable sources. For biographical articles and articles on fringe science, there is some loosening of these requirements. Works by the topic of a biographical article are relevant to the article whether their writing was published in a reliable journal/publisher or not. Also, the contents of a journal devoted to a fringe science can provide evidence as to the past or current thinking within that fringe field. However, the fringe science journals cannot provide evidence for the outright notability of the topic. ==Notes== {{note|1|Note 1}}: The scientific contribution must have a major entry in the work. A passing mention of the concept is not sufficient. {{note|2|Note 2}}: Citation counts and peer review mechanisms differ vastly between sciences, fields, and subfields, and editors are urged to inform the relevant [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Directory/Science|WikiProject]] about ongoing debates to get expert input. It should also be noted that ''quantity'' of citations is often only a poor approximation of ''quality''. {{note|3|Note 3}}: A "research field" indicates an established area of study for which the topic in question is only a part. A topic cannot be its own research field, nor can it gain notability from being part of a field which is non-notable. == See also == * [[Wikipedia:Fringe theories]] * [[Wikipedia:Notability (academics)]] * [[Wikipedia:Notability (numbers)]] * [[Wikipedia:Notability (science)/Test cases]] * [[:Category:AfD debates (Science and technology)]] * [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources]] * [[List of academic journal search engines]]

revision.text:
==Results of the third [[WP:DC|Danny's Contest]]== __NOTOC__ ===Overview=== After much deliberation of the [[Wikipedia:Danny's contest/Contest entries|contest entries]] the judges have arrived at a decision.
The entries could be broken down into three broad groups... entries that didn't seem to have much, if any, improvement, entries that were a "good try" and a handful of entries that really took the contest to heart and added a lot of interesting and germane references.
===Criteria=== The judges graded on 4 major criteria: {|class="wikitable" |- !Criterion !Description !Weight |- |'''Number of citations''' |Just a raw count of how many were added. This was a good filter to see if the article could make the finalists... only 2 or 3 refs suggested that maybe not so much had been done. |(20%) |- |'''Complexity of citations''' |A gauge of the difficulty level of adding them. Were they notes? web cites? book cites? did they use ISBN tagging? were there multiple places that got the same note? Notes ON notes? |(30%) |- |'''Appropriateness of cites''' |Were they actually GOOD cites that moved the article forward? |(20%) |- |'''Overall article improvement''' |How much was the article helped (expanded, quality increased, made more pleasing to the eye) by cites added? |(30%) |}
===Finalists=== The three most impressive articles were as follows... ANY of them could easily be FA candidates shortly. {|class="wikitable" |- !Article !Description !Before/After !Contestant |- |'''[[Battle of Ceresole]]''' |An important battle in medieval history, part of the [[Italian Wars]] series. Characterised by contemporaries as "marvellously confused" this battle is attractively illustrated with lots of maps and diagrams. One would expect Kyrill as coordinator of [[WP:MILHIST]] to do a good job of improving an article, and Kyrill does not disappoint. A very powerful article about an interesting battle. |[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Battle_of_Ceresole&oldid=75325524 Before], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Battle_of_Ceresole&oldid=79578007 After] |[[User:Kirill Lokshin|Kirill Lokshin]] |- |'''[[Theramenes]]''' |An important general and historical figure of ancient Greece, including participating in an Athenian coup, multiple battles, and a rebellion. He even had notoriety after death. The article is challenging due to a paucity of sources, but Robth found 80+ cites. There also is an innovative organisation of sources into modern and ancient. A very good article based on some painstaking research. |[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Theramenes&direction=next&oldid=42506901 Before], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Theramenes&oldid=77860528 After] |[[User:Robth|Robth]] |- |'''[[Crawford expedition]]''' |A very understudied but important battle in the [[American Revolution]]. The winning side often tends to ignore battles they lost, and this article was not much more than a single paragraph stub when Kevin went to town on it. It is now profusely illustrated with maps, paintings, tables and diagrams and has grown to 43 Kb. In addition to 88 high quality footnotes, it also has a comprehensive "references" and "for further reading" section, properly separated out. All books have good ISBN links. This article is a real tour de force and shows the power of our encyclopedia well. |[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Crawford_expedition&oldid=74771366 Before], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Crawford_expedition&oldid=79931979 After] |[[User:Kevin Myers|Kevin Myers]] |}
That all of these articles were somehow military related was surely coincidence! :)
===The winners=== * The overall winner, as selected by the judges, is: [[Crawford expedition]]. Congratulations to [[User:Kevin Myers|Kevin Myers]] who wins a 100 USD gift certificate from Danny. Please contact Danny for details.
Honorable Mentions: * [[Battle of Ceresole]] and [[Theramenes]] are both awarded honorable mentions, and their authors win 35 USD gift certificates at Amazon from Danny. Please contact Danny for details.
===For the Judges=== * [[User:Amgine|Amgine]] (inactive) * [[User:Fuzheado|Fuzheado]] (inactive) * [[User:Lar|Lar]] * [[User:Sannse|Sannse]] * [[User:Shanel|Shanel]]
++[[User:Lar|Lar]]: [[User_talk:Lar|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/Lar|c]] 22:07, 2 November 2006 (UTC)

{{album|class=redirect}} ==Fair use rationale for Image:PauletteCarlson It'sAboutTime.jpg== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:PauletteCarlson It'sAboutTime.jpg]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in '''this''' Wikipedia article constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]].
Please go to [[:Image:PauletteCarlson It'sAboutTime.jpg|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to insure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page.
If there is other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images uploaded after 4 May, 2006, and lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you.<!-- Template:Missing rationale2 -->
[[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] ([[User talk:BetacommandBot|talk]]) 22:36, 5 December 2007 (UTC)

{{Infobox professional wrestler | name = Lobo | image = |birth_name=Joe Eubanks | names = '''Lobo'''
Sheriff Lobo | height = {{height|ft=5|in=10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/profiles/l/lobo.html|title=Lobo Profile|accessdate=2007-05-07|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} | weight = {{convert|235|lb|kg|abbr=on}} | birth_date = 1975 | birth_place = [[New Jersey]] | death_date = | death_place = | resides = [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] | billed = His Own Personal Hell | trainer = [[John Zandig]] | debut = 1999 | retired = }} '''Joe Eubanks''' (born 1975) is an [[United States|American]] [[professional wrestling|professional wrestler]] best known by the [[ring name]] '''Lobo'''. He wrestled primarily in [[Combat Zone Wrestling]] (CZW), where he won every major championship and was the first inductee into the [[CZW Hall of Fame]] in 2004. He was formerly the CZW Commissioner/Talent Coordinator.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/040207.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling 5th Anniversary Show February 7, 2004 - Philadelphia, Pennsylvania - ECW Arena|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} ==Career== ===1999-2002=== Along with [[Nick Gage]], [[Justice Pain]], and [[Ric Blade]], Lobo was trained by [[John Zandig]] at the CZW Wrestling School and graduated first in the class.[http://www.freewebs.com/andy_czw1/history.html CZWHookup : The history of CZW] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080210134119/http://www.freewebs.com/andy_czw1/history.html |date=2008-02-10 }} He became one of the main wrestlers in CZW along with other graduates from the school. In February 1999, Lobo became the second [[CZW Iron Man Championship|Iron Man Champion]]. He held the title until June when he lost it to Justice Pain.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/990619.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling - CZW Down in Flames June 19, 1999 - Mantua, NJ |accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} These two continued wrestling each other and competed in the first ever Cage of Death match at the first ''Cage of Death'' show.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/991016.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling - CZW Cage of Death October 16, 1999 - Mantua, NJ|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} Lobo won the match and regained the title. He would lose this title to [[Matt Prince|Wifebeater]], but regain it one more time the following year.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/000311.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling - CZW March Violence March 11, 2000 - Sewell, NJ|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} Lobo also challenged for the [[CZW World Heavyweight Championship|CZW Heavyweight Championship]]. He feuded with Zandig for the title and finally beat him in July 2000. He held the title until ''Cage of Death II''.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/000909.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling - CZW Cage of Death II....After Dark September 9, 2000 - Sewell, NJ|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} At that show, Lobo successfully defended the championship against Zandig in the Cage of Death match. Directly following this match, Justice Pain came out and fought Lobo in another Cage of Death match. In the match, Lobo was thrown from the top of the cage to the ground through a table covered in barbed wire. Justice Pain went on to win the match and the title. After losing the title, Lobo continued feuding with Zandig. This time, the feud was for ownership of CZW. On February 9, 2002, Lobo defeated Zandig to become the new owner of CZW. He held this position until ''Cage of Death IV'' when Zandig defeated him to regain his position as CZW's owner {{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/021213.html|title=Combat Zone Wrestling December 13, 2002 - Philadelphia, PA - Viking Hall|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} ===2003-present=== He took some time off from CZW following the Cage of Death match. While he was gone, a new group called the Hi-V tried to take over CZW, with Zandig as their main target. Zandig was planning to face the Hi-V at ''Cage of Death V'', but the stable outnumbered his team 6 to 4. At ''Night of Infamy II'',{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/031115.html|title=Night of Infamy II - November 15, 2003 Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} Lobo made a shocking return to help Zandig and join his team just in time for Cage of Death.{{cite web|url=http://live.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/031213.html|title=Cage of Death V December 13, 2003 - Philadelphia, Pennsylvania |accessdate=2009-08-05|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}} Their team was successful. In February 2004, Lobo became the first inductee to the CZW Hall of Fame. After this, Lobo remained inactive for the following two years. At [[Cage of Death 7]], [[Zandig]], who had turned on the fans, wanted to run CZW the way they used to. He called out Lobo, who was backstage for the event, and they joined each other along with [[Justice Pain]] and [[Nick Gage]]. They would later call themselves the Forefathers of CZW.{{cite web|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/results/czw/_2006/|title=2006 results |accessdate=2009-09-04|date=|author=|publisher=}} ==In wrestling== *'''Finishing moves''' **[[Professional wrestling throws#Death Valley driver|Death Valley driver]] **[[DDT (professional wrestling)#Jumping DDT|Jumping DDT]] **[[Sharpshooter (professional wrestling)|Sharpshooter]] **[[Powerbomb#Sitout powerbomb|Sitout powerbomb]] *'''Signature moves''' **[[Professional wrestling attacks#Spinning heel kick|Spinning wheel kick]] **[[Professional wrestling aerial techniques#Suicide|Suicide dive]] **[[Suplex#High-angle belly-to-back suplex|Wrist-lock high-angle belly to back suplex]] ==Championships and accomplishments== *'''[[Combat Zone Wrestling]]''' :*CZW Interpromotional Hardcore Championship (1 time) :*[[CZW Iron Man Championship]] ([[CZW Iron Man Championship#Title history|3 times]]) :*[[CZW World Heavyweight Championship]] ([[CZW World Heavyweight Championship#History|1 time]]) :*[[CZW World Tag Team Championship]] ([[CZW World Tag Team Championship#History|1 time]]) - with T.C.K. :*[[CZW Hall of Fame]] |title=Combat Zone Wrestling show archives (2001) |publisher=CZWrestling.com |accessdate=2009-05-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100116122346/http://czwrestling.com/archives/2001.html |archivedate=2010-01-16 |df= }} *{{Cite web|url=http://www.czwrestling.com/archives/2002.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303231259/http://www.czwrestling.com/archives/2002.html |archivedate=2016-03-03 |df= }} *{{Cite web|url=http://www.czwrestling.com/archives/2003.html
